docs.snippet: Ryan Spadola, a rookie free agent from Lehigh, is trying to win a spot as a wide receiver on the team’s 53-man roster....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ryan Spadola, a rookie free agent from Lehigh, is trying to win a spot as a wide receiver on the team’s 53-man roster.
docs.abstract: New York Jets rookie wide receiver Ryan Spadola will try to solidify a spot on the team's 53-man roster in exhibition game against Philadelphia Eagles; throughout training camp, Spadola has improved in almost every way, from catching passes to running precise routes to contributing on special teams.

headline.main: Catch by Catch, Rookie Receiver Builds Case for Making the Jets
headline.print_headline: Catch by Catch, Rookie Receiver Builds Case for Making the Jets

docs.lead_paragraph: Matt Flynn is in almost the same situation as last year: with Terrelle Pryor playing Thursday, Flynn, slowed by a sore elbow, could lose out on a starting quarterback job.
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; Oakland Raiders quarterback Matt Flynn, slowed by a sore elbow, could lose starting position to Terrelle Pryor; other football developments noted.

docs.snippet: Although Coach Tom Coughlin intends to limit Eli Manning and the rest of the first-team offense to 12 to 15 snaps in Thursday’s preseason finale against the Patriots, he is pushing for results....
docs.lead_paragraph: Although Coach Tom Coughlin intends to limit Eli Manning and the rest of the first-team offense to 12 to 15 snaps in Thursday’s preseason finale against the Patriots, he is pushing for results.
docs.abstract: New York Giants lack of offense remains a concern, having scored only two touchdowns  as team heads into preseason finale against New England Patriots.

headline.main: Heading Into Preseason Finale, Giants’ Offense Is a Concern
headline.print_headline: Heading Into Preseason Finale, Giants’ Offense Is a Concern

docs.snippet: In a closely watched case, a judge is expected to decide soon whether to dismiss a lawsuit brought by retired players alleging that the N.F.L. intentionally misled them about the dangers of head injuries....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a closely watched case, a judge is expected to decide soon whether to dismiss a lawsuit brought by retired players alleging that the N.F.L. intentionally misled them about the dangers of head injuries.
docs.abstract: Judge Anita B Brody is expected to rule on the NFL’s motion to dismiss hundreds of consolidated cases in which football players allege that the league intentionally misled them about the dangers of head injuries; regardless of her decision, case will provide a framework for similar lawsuits brought by football players and other athletes who say that a league failed to protect them adequately.

headline.main: Concussion Case Nears Key Phase for N.F.L.
headline.print_headline: Concussion Case Nears Key Phase For N.F.L.

docs.snippet: Texas A&M quarterback Johnny Manziel was suspended for the first half of Saturday’s game against Rice, but the N.C.A.A. said there was no evidence he had received money in exchange for autographs....
docs.lead_paragraph: Texas A&M quarterback Johnny Manziel was suspended for the first half of Saturday’s game against Rice, but the N.C.A.A. said there was no evidence he had received money in exchange for autographs.
docs.abstract: Texas A&M quarterback Johnny Manziel is suspended for first half of season opener against Rice because of what NCAA calls 'inadvertent' violation in alleged autograph signing scandal.

headline.main: Manziel Must Sit Out First Half of Opener for ‘Inadvertent Violation’
headline.print_headline: Manziel Must Sit Out Half of Opener for ‘Inadvertent Violation’

docs.abstract: Profile of Fresno State quarterback Derek Carr, who is preparing with the team for season opener against Rutgers; Carr's son was born with a dangerous medical condition on Aug 6, which required two surgeries to fix.

docs.snippet: Four months after a fertilizer plant explosion tore through their small Texas community, killing 15 people and damaging buildings for blocks around, the West Trojans opened their football season and recovered a degree of normalcy that's been missi...
docs.lead_paragraph: Four months after a fertilizer plant explosion tore through their small Texas community, killing 15 people and damaging buildings for blocks around, the West Trojans opened their football season and recovered a degree of normalcy that's been missing since the blast.

headline.main: Football Returns to Texas Town Hit by Plant Blast
headline.print_headline: Football Returns to Texas Town Hit by Plant Blast

docs.snippet: The NFL agreed to pay more than three-quarters of a billion dollars to settle lawsuits from thousands of former players who developed dementia or other concussion-related health problems they say were caused by the very on-field violence that fuel...
docs.lead_paragraph: The NFL agreed to pay more than three-quarters of a billion dollars to settle lawsuits from thousands of former players who developed dementia or other concussion-related health problems they say were caused by the very on-field violence that fueled the game's rise to popularity and profit.

headline.main: NFL Agrees to Pay $765M to Settle Concussion Suits
headline.print_headline: NFL Agrees to Pay $765M to Settle Concussion Suits

docs.snippet: A U.S. Naval Academy midshipman asked one of three former football players accused of sexually assaulting her to tell Navy investigators nothing happened, according to a recording of a telephone call played at a military hearing Thursday....
